alert.note: Alert for Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 3:48PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A few thunderstorm are impacting portions of northeastern San Juan County through 430 PM MDT... At 346 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking some thunderstorms about 12 miles southwest of La Sal, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph, pea size hail and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... La Sal. This includes U.S. Highway 191 in Utah between mile markers 87 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Canyonlands, Natural Bridges; La Sal and Abajo Mountains
